intro: Psychotria solfiana subsp. fleuryana, commonly known as the Fleuryana Psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces berries that are usually red or yellow when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
